rationale: The MD5 hash algorithm is cryptographically broken and vulnerable to collision attacks. The signature appears to be used for logging/debugging purposes rather than security-critical operations. Replacing MD5 with SHA256 provides a more secure hash while maintaining the same functionality for debugging/logging purposes.
patch:
--- app.py
+++ app.py
@@ -153,7 +153,7 @@ def api_create_todo():
     todo = Todo(title=title, complete=False)
     db.session.add(todo)
     db.session.commit()
-    sig = hashlib.md5(title.encode()).hexdigest()
+    sig = hashlib.sha256(title.encode()).hexdigest()
     print(f"Storing signature for todo {todo.id}: {sig}")
 
     return jsonify({
